intro: Erigeron villarsii, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron villarsii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
